page.title: 03RECORD OF CATTERICK-TUNSTALL
page.content: This area is steeped in history. Indeed Catterick is mentioned in the original Domesday book, its given name being Catrik. It is not unusual for a farmer to unearth some relic of the past and archaeologists are regular visitors. In square twelve of this block there is a Tumulas - a Roman burial ground. Brough Hall dates back to the Norman Conquest. It was the home of the De burg family and in turn the Lawson family. When Sir Ralph Lawson Bart died the hall was sold to a building contractor who has since divided it into flats and furbished them in keeping with present day lifestyle. The origins of Tunstall are also mentioned in the Domesday book. The village has changed very little over the generations, the passing of time making very little impression on it.
